### K-pop, J-pop and Western

```{r}
#source('dependencies.R')
library(ggplot2)
library(tidyverse)
library(spotifyr)
library(extrafont)
#font_import()
#loadfonts(dev = "win")
musicology <- get_playlist_audio_features("", "4qytaIOVyWpUF2ncTXkjLZ") %>%
  mutate(artist.name = map_chr(track.artists, function(x) x$name[1]))
ggplot(musicology, aes(energy, danceability, color = artist.name)) +
  geom_point(size = 5, alpha = 0.4) +
  theme(text = element_text(family = "Georgia", color = "Gray25")) +
  labs(title = "Artists show different distributions in energy and danceability",
       y = "Danceability", 
       x = "Energy",
       subtitle = "The Script shows a lot of diversity")
```
